qa_data.question: What is a Legal Heir in succession matters?
qa_data.answer: A Legal Heir is a person who has entitlement to a share in the property of the deceased.

qa_data.question: Who is considered an Applicant in succession cases?
qa_data.answer: An Applicant is a person who is authorized to act on behalf of all other legal heirs for the purpose of filing an application.

qa_data.question: What constitutes a Factual Controversy in succession matters?
qa_data.answer: A Factual Controversy is an objection by legal heirs or by any claimant of legal heirship, any dispute which may arise in establishing the identity of legal heir which is not resolvable by the Authority or any situation, matter or event requiring adjudication or recording of evidence by the Court or where at least one of the legal heirs is a MINOR.

qa_data.question: What is the jurisdiction for Succession Law application?
qa_data.answer: The jurisdiction is the geographical boundary where the Succession Law is applicable i.e. Whole of ICT, Punjab, Sindh, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Balochistan, AJK & GB.

qa_data.question: What is a Succession Facilitation Unit (SFU)?
qa_data.answer: SFU is a Succession Facilitation Unit established for the purpose of receiving, assessing and processing of applications regarding Letter of Administration/Succession Certificate/Decline Certificate.

qa_data.question: What does Property include in succession matters?
qa_data.answer: Property includes moveable and immoveable property of the deceased person.

qa_data.question: What is an Authorization Letter in succession applications?
qa_data.answer: Authorization Letter is prescribed format specified in Schedule I of Federal and Provincial Succession Rules for authorizing/acknowledging one of the Legal Heir (Legal Counsel also for Sindh and Balochistan) for the purpose of filing Succession application. It includes deceased, applicant and legal heir(s) particulars as well as deceased property and share of legal heir(s).

qa_data.question: What is Board Verification in succession processes?
qa_data.answer: Board Verification is the process for verifying legal heir of the deceased through a board of three designated personnel of the Authority where fingerprints of such legal heirs are not available in Authority's database and it is not possible to update fingerprints due to valid reason i.e. settled abroad, bedridden, amputated etc.

qa_data.question: Who is a Legal Counsel in succession matters?
qa_data.answer: A Legal Counsel is an advocate with a valid bar license who represents a person in Court of Law.

qa_data.question: What is an Authority Letter for succession certificates?
qa_data.answer: It is a written statement in order to authorize someone on behalf of the applicant to collect Succession Certificate / Letter of Administration / Decline Certificate only.

qa_data.question: Who can apply for succession certificate in Sindh?
qa_data.answer: In Sindh, succession applications require presence of the authorized legal heir (Legal heir or Legal Counsel). Legal Counsel with valid bar license can represent applicants. Wakalat Nama is required in favour of Legal Counsel by Primary Applicant for applications filed through Legal Counsel.

qa_data.question: Who can apply for succession certificate in Balochistan?
qa_data.answer: In Balochistan, succession applications require presence of the authorized legal heir (Legal heir or Legal Counsel). Legal Counsel with valid bar license can represent applicants. Wakalat Nama is required in favour of Legal Counsel by Primary Applicant for applications filed through Legal Counsel.

qa_data.question: Who can apply for succession certificate in Punjab?
qa_data.answer: In Punjab, succession applications require presence of the authorized legal heir. Legal Counsel representation is not specifically mentioned as mandatory for Punjab applications.

qa_data.question: Who can apply for succession certificate in KPK?
qa_data.answer: In KPK, succession applications require presence of the authorized legal heir. Legal Counsel representation is not specifically mentioned as mandatory for KPK applications.

qa_data.question: Who can apply for succession certificate in Islamabad/Federal?
qa_data.answer: In Islamabad/Federal, succession applications require presence of the authorized legal heir. Legal Counsel representation is not specifically mentioned as mandatory for Federal applications.

qa_data.question: What is Wakalat Nama requirement for Sindh and Balochistan?
qa_data.answer: Wakalat Nama is required in favour of Legal Counsel by Primary Applicant for application filed through Legal Counsel along with valid Bar License (for Sindh & Balochistan only).

qa_data.question: What documents are required for a fresh Succession Certificate application?
qa_data.answer: Required documents are: 1. Death Certificate of deceased issued by Municipal Authority/UC/Cantonment, 2. Deceased CNIC/NICOP/POC cancellation Receipt, 3. Copies of CNICs/NICOPs/POCs of legal heirs, 4. Authorization Letter (as per Schedule-I), 5. Family Registration Certificate FRC (Alpha or Beta or both), 6. Original ownership documents of Moveable/Immoveable Asset(s), 7. Wakalat Nama for application processed through Legal Counsel (Sindh and Balochistan), 8. Any other document (if required) as NADRA may deem fit as per Law.

qa_data.question: What are the steps for processing a fresh Succession Certificate application?
qa_data.answer: Steps are: 1. Assessment of application, documents and details of legal heirs through available NADRA Verification tools, 2. Data entry of applicant, deceased and Legal Heir(s) particulars, deceased property details along with shares of legal heirs as per Personal Law, 3. Scanning of documents with correct document title, 4. Advertisement/Public Notice in two nationwide circulated Newspapers (3x in Sindh only), 5. Objection Recording (If any objection is received within 14 days of publication of notice), 6. Biometric Verification of all legal heirs, 7. Approval, Printing, Receiving and Delivery of SC/LOA.

qa_data.question: How many newspaper advertisements are required for Sindh succession applications?
qa_data.answer: For Sindh succession applications, Advertisement/Public Notice must be published in three (3x) nationwide circulated Newspapers, while other provinces require only two newspapers.

qa_data.question: What documents are required for a Decline Certificate application?
qa_data.answer: Documents same as fresh application plus document justifying the reason of Decline i.e. FRC for minor.

qa_data.question: What are the steps for processing a Decline Certificate?
qa_data.answer: Steps are: 1. Submission of application to OIC SFU, 2. Data entry of applicant, deceased, Legal Heir(s) particulars, deceased property details and decline reason, 3. Scanning of documents with correct document title, 4. Approval, Printing, Receiving and Delivery of Decline Certificate.

qa_data.question: What documents are required for reprint of lost/damaged Succession Certificate?
qa_data.answer: Required documents are: 1. Applicant CNIC/NICOP/POC, 2. Copy of the FIR/Police Report (for Lost/Stolen Certificate) or 3. Original SC/LOA (for Damaged Certificate).

qa_data.question: What are the steps for reprint of lost/damaged certificate?
qa_data.answer: Steps are: 1. Retrieval of already processed application data with input as Tracking ID, Document ID and Date of Issue, 2. Scanning of documents with correct document title, 3. Approval, Printing, Receiving & Delivery of SC/LOA.

qa_data.question: What documents are required for Office Mistake/Amendment applications?
qa_data.answer: Required documents are: 1. Applicant CNIC/NICOP/POC, 2. Original SC/LOA, 3. Revised Authorization Certificate with correct information (in case of Amendment only).

qa_data.question: What are the steps for Office Mistake/Amendment applications?
qa_data.answer: Steps are: 1. Retrieval of already processed application data with input as Tracking ID, Document ID and Date of Issue, 2. Correction in applicant, deceased, legal heir's particulars and assets/property details highlighted by the applicant, 3. Scanning of documents with correct document title, 4. Advertisement/Public Notice in two nationwide circulated Newspaper (3x Newspaper for Sindh only), 5. Objection recording (If objection received within 14 days of publication of notice), 6. Biometric Verification of all legal heirs, 7. Approval, Printing, Receiving and Delivery of SC/LOA.

qa_data.answer: New/Fresh Application: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 20,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 10,000. Duplicate Application: Rs. 5,000. Amend Application (Modification/Reprint Loss): Rs. 5,000. Decline Certificate Fee: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 15,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 5,000. Office Mistake: Free of Cost.

qa_data.question: What are the Succession Certificate fees for Sindh?
qa_data.answer: New/Fresh Application: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 22,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 10,000. Duplicate Application: Rs. 5,000. Amend Application (Modification/Reprint Loss): Rs. 5,000. Decline Certificate Fee: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 17,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 5,000. Office Mistake: Free of Cost.

qa_data.question: What are the Succession Certificate fees for Punjab?
qa_data.answer: New/Fresh Application: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 20,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 10,000. Duplicate Application: Rs. 5,000. Amend Application (Modification/Reprint Loss): Rs. 5,000. Decline Certificate Fee: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 15,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 5,000. Office Mistake: Free of Cost.

qa_data.question: What are the Succession Certificate fees for KPK?
qa_data.answer: New/Fresh Application: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 20,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 10,000. Duplicate Application: Rs. 5,000. Amend Application (Modification/Reprint Loss): Rs. 5,000. Decline Certificate Fee: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 15,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 5,000. Office Mistake: Free of Cost.

qa_data.question: What are the Succession Certificate fees for Balochistan?
qa_data.answer: New/Fresh Application: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 20,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 10,000. Duplicate Application: Rs. 5,000. Amend Application (Modification/Reprint Loss): Rs. 5,000. Decline Certificate Fee: Assets ≥ 100,000: Rs. 15,000, Assets < 100,000: Rs. 5,000. Office Mistake: Free of Cost.

qa_data.question: What is the mode of payment for Succession Certificate fees?
qa_data.answer: Mode of payment for Succession Certificate is CASH ONLY. Fees can be different for different provinces, so please confirm the city name and which province it's located in.

qa_data.question: When are cases referred to Zonal Verification Board?
qa_data.answer: Cases will be referred to Zonal Verification Board where fingerprints of any of the legal heir(s) are not verified and it is unable to update fingerprints due to valid reasons i.e. settled abroad, bedridden, old age etc.

qa_data.question: What is the composition of Zonal Board?
qa_data.answer: Composition of Zonal Board: 1. President: DD/AD Zone, 2. Member-1: Office In-Charge SFU, Member-2: Desk Operator SFU.

qa_data.question: What are the actions available for Zonal Board decisions?
qa_data.answer: Actions are Clear (a) or Reject (b). Clear: Use 'Biometric Clear' option to Clear case from Succession Unified Web Portal. Reject: Use 'Case Reject' option to reject case from Succession Unified Web Portal.

qa_data.question: What documents must be attached for Zonal Board decisions?
qa_data.answer: Documents to be attached are: 1. Notice, 2. Board Proceedings, 3. Affidavit as per prescribed format, 4. Minute Sheet duly approved from Regional DG.

qa_data.question: Who processes Zonal Board decisions?
qa_data.answer: Regional DD/AD Operations Branch nominated by respective Region processes the decisions.

qa_data.question: What is the minimum quorum for Zonal Board?
qa_data.answer: Minimum quorum for Zonal Board is President and 1 × member. It shall be conducted on weekly basis.

qa_data.question: What are the responsibilities of Board President?
qa_data.answer: President of the Board shall ensure presence of the board members. Board members shall assist President in all ways and means (Reports, Archive record etc.).

qa_data.question: What qualifications are required for Board members?
qa_data.answer: Board members shall have good knowledge of Succession Laws, Rules and Registration Policy.

qa_data.question: When is Board reconstituted?
qa_data.answer: Board shall be reconstituted by respective RHO immediately if any member is posted/suspended/terminated/resigned.

qa_data.question: How are Board proceedings conducted for overseas legal heirs?
qa_data.answer: Board proceedings will be conducted using modern device/video call as per Section 6(5) of Succession Laws for legal heirs unable to visit designated SFU due to valid reason i.e. settled abroad, bedridden.

qa_data.question: Who files the succession application and how?
qa_data.answer: Application will be filed by the legal heir (Legal Counsel also for Sindh & Balochistan) authorized by all legal heirs in prescribed form (Schedule I duly completed and attested by Oath Commissioner).

qa_data.question: From which office can applicant apply for succession certificate?
qa_data.answer: Applicant can apply from any office of the Authority within the Province where deceased was resided at the time of his death or where asset(s) of the deceased is/are located.

qa_data.question: How is succession application processed when applicant's fingerprints are not verified?
qa_data.answer: Succession application where fingerprints of the applicant is not verified will be processed through Facial Matching. For application where Sole Legal Heir is processed through Facial Matching applicant will ensure presence of one blood relative including spouse as verifier.

qa_data.question: What additional requirement exists for immoveable properties in Sindh?
qa_data.answer: Applicant has to provide Certificate of Ownership (Search Certificate) issued from respective Authority/Department/Institution in addition to the original ownership documents for immoveable properties of the deceased (For Sindh Only).

qa_data.question: What is OIC's role in succession application processing?
qa_data.answer: OIC will interview the applicant and endorse ORIGINAL SEEN stamp before processing the application.

qa_data.question: Who signs the acknowledgement print preview?
qa_data.answer: Applicant, Desk Operator and OIC will sign the print preview of acknowledgement to concede correctness of recorded information.

qa_data.question: What CNIC status issues need to be resolved before processing?
qa_data.answer: CNIC status flags (Missing Biometrics, SI, Fraud marked, digitally impounded, P.O. etc.) need to be corrected/fixed as per Registration Policy in vogue prior to processing of Succession application.

qa_data.question: Are foreign death certificates acceptable?
qa_data.answer: Yes, Death Certificate issued by foreign authority duly attested by Pak Embassy/Consulate is acceptable.

qa_data.question: What is the expiration time for incomplete applications?
qa_data.answer: Application not completed in terms of documentary requirements and biometric verification by the legal heirs up to 365 days (Expiration Time) from the date of processing will be void and application has to be filed afresh.

qa_data.question: What are the biometric capture procedures during succession application?
qa_data.answer: Photograph and fingerprints of the applicant will be captured while processing application. Legal heirs' fingerprints will be captured on their availability, failing which Facial Verification will be done. Legal Heirs settled abroad can provide fingerprints online at Pak-ID Mobile App or DAUs Abroad (for Fresh, Office Mistake & Amendment applications).

qa_data.question: When is biometric verification not required for legal heirs?
qa_data.answer: Legal heir's Biometric Verification (except applicant) will not be carried out for Decline & Reprint-Lost applications.

qa_data.question: When is Board Verification conducted for legal heirs?
qa_data.answer: Legal Heirs will be verified through Board Verification where Legal Heir(s) fingerprints are not verified and it is unable to update fingerprints for being settled abroad, bedridden or for any other valid reason for not visiting NRC/DAU.

qa_data.question: What is the scanning requirement for documents?
qa_data.answer: Scanning of documents will be made on the same day and it will be ensured to scan documents with respective document title i.e. affidavit should be scanned against the affidavit category selected from the drop down menu at the scanning stage.

qa_data.question: Can succession applications be cancelled on the same day?
qa_data.answer: Yes, application can be cancelled on same day (on irreversible problem before scanning of documents) and no fee will be charged.

qa_data.question: What happens when there are minors in deceased family as legal heirs?
qa_data.answer: For minors in deceased family as legal heir(s), application will be processed to issue Decline Certificate. If deceased is MNIC holder, application will also be processed to issue Decline Certificate.

qa_data.question: How are applications from extended family processed?
qa_data.answer: Applications from extended family (beyond Alpha and Beta Family of the deceased) will be processed to issue Decline Certificate.

qa_data.question: When are Decline Certificates issued on Court Orders?
qa_data.answer: Application will be processed to issue Decline Certificate on Court Orders/Directions.

qa_data.question: How is Decline Certificate issued and what details are recorded?
qa_data.answer: Decline Certificate will be issued through Succession software. Legal heirs, deceased asset's details and decline reason will be recorded. For deceased with MNIC and extended family case, only deceased asset's details will be entered.

qa_data.question: When is Decline Certificate issued on Factual Controversy?
qa_data.answer: Decline Certificate on Factual Controversy will be issued on the same day of processing of the application.

qa_data.question: Can Succession Certificate be processed after Decline Certificate issuance?
qa_data.answer: Yes, application for Succession Certificate/Letter of Administration will be processed once reason of decline is eliminated even if Decline Certificate has been issued previously.

qa_data.question: How many decline reasons can be selected for Decline Certificate?
qa_data.answer: Only one reason can be selected while processing of Decline Certificate application from the decline reason library.

qa_data.question: What is the objection period and procedure?
qa_data.answer: Any aggrieved person may approach the OIC of respective SFU for objection within fourteen (14) days after publication of notice in Newspaper. On receiving objection through letter, email or telephone, objector will be informed to submit objection by appearing in person or by any person authorized through Special Power of Attorney.

qa_data.question: What happens if objector fails to appear for objection recording?
qa_data.answer: No objection will be entertained if objector fails to appear in person at concerned SFU for objection recording.

qa_data.question: What documents must objector submit?
qa_data.answer: Objector has to submit written objection on plain paper along with justifiable documentary evidence that will be scanned and uploaded at Succession Web Portal by authorized user. Objector(s) Fingerprints will be captured, and receipt will be provided to the objector after recording objection.

qa_data.question: What happens when objection is recorded?
qa_data.answer: On objection (after hearing the applicant), process on application will be stopped and system generated Decline Certificate will be issued to the applicant after 14 Days' Notice Period. Decision on objection as claimant of legal heir of the deceased will be made on updation of objector's record through respective DAU or Zonal office.

qa_data.question: Is there any refund available when application is declined on objection?
qa_data.answer: Yes, applicant will be refunded Rs. 5000/- as per Schedule IV (of Federal/Provincial Succession Rules) through cross cheque if application is declined on objection and its receiving will be maintained at SFU and updated at Web Portal as well.

qa_data.question: Can fresh application be filed after objection settlement?
qa_data.answer: Yes, fresh application for Letter of Administration or Succession Certificate can be filed after settlement on objection/factual grounds even if Decline Certificate has been issued previously.

qa_data.question: Who can collect the Succession Certificate/Letter of Administration?
qa_data.answer: SC/LOA will be delivered to the applicant on self-presence (with/without token slip) or legal heir (with original token slip) or any other person (with original token slip and authority letter from applicant).

qa_data.question: What are the consequences of concealment of facts in succession application?
qa_data.answer: If any concealment of fact including concealment of legal heirs of the deceased is found, applicant shall be liable to face legal action as per prevailing law and Letter of Administration/Succession Certificate shall deemed to be cancelled by the issuing Authority forthwith.

qa_data.question: What is the procedure for duplicate certificate issuance?
qa_data.answer: Duplicate SC/LOA will be issued on the same day of processing of application in favour of Primary Applicant to whom it was previously issued with change in Tracking ID, Certificate Number and Date of Issue only.

qa_data.question: What corrections are allowed in Office Mistake/Amendment applications?
qa_data.answer: Only textual correction in applicant, deceased, legal heir(s) particulars and asset/property details specific fields highlighted by the applicant will be made without any addition/deletion any time after receiving of SC/LOA in Office Mistake/Amendment application.

qa_data.question: What happens to original certificate in case of damaged certificate?
qa_data.answer: Original Certificate will be surrendered (in case of damaged Certificate) that will be pierced/defaced before the applicant.

qa_data.question: Who can apply for Reprint-Lost/Duplicate/Office Mistake/Amendment applications?
qa_data.answer: Any of the Legal Heir can apply for Reprint-Lost/Duplicate/Office Mistake/Amendment applications.

qa_data.question: When is Authorization Certificate/Affidavit not required?
qa_data.answer: Authorization Certificate/Affidavit is not required for Reprint-Lost Certificate and Office Mistake applications.

qa_data.question: When is Revised Authorization Letter required?
qa_data.answer: Revised Authorization Letter is required for Amendment application.

qa_data.question: What is required for OIC SFU/DSFU to process Office Mistake or Amendment?
qa_data.answer: OIC SFU/DSFU will initiate Monitoring & Evaluation Performa (Annex-E) for Office Mistake or Amendment and such application will be processed on approval of Regional DG that will be scanned and uploaded at Web Portal.

qa_data.question: What notice procedure is followed under Section 6(5)?
qa_data.answer: Notice under Section 6(5) of relevant Succession Law shall be served to the applicant as per prescribed format (Annex-B).

qa_data.question: What affidavit is required from applicant for Board Verification?
qa_data.answer: Applicant has to submit an affidavit duly attested by Oath Commissioner as per prescribed format (Annex-C) to confirm on oath that person whose fingerprints are not being verified is the true legal heir of the deceased.

qa_data.question: How are Board proceedings prepared and forwarded?
qa_data.answer: Board proceedings will be prepared duly completed/signed as per prescribed format (Annex-D) and forwarded to respective Regional Operations Branch.

qa_data.question: How does Regional Operations Branch validate cases?
qa_data.answer: Regional Operations Branch will validate the case through Unified Succession Web Portal ensuring that all documents/evidences mentioned above are uploaded before validating the case.

qa_data.question: What interview process is conducted by Board members?
qa_data.answer: Board members shall conduct detailed interview of legal heir whose fingerprints are not verified personally. Board members shall verify concerned person data on verifying tools.

qa_data.question: What Succession Laws and Rules apply to different provinces?
qa_data.answer: Punjab Succession and Letter of Administration Rules, 2020. Letter of Administration and Succession Certificate (Punjab Amendment) Rules, 2021. Succession Certificate/Letter of Administration/Inheritance/Mutation (Sindh Amendment) Rules, 2021. Letter of Administration and Succession Certificate (KPK Amendment) Rules, 2021. Letter of Administration and Succession Certificate (Balochistan Amendment) Rules, 2021. Letter of Administration and Succession Certificate (Islamabad Capital Territory Amendment) Rules, 2022. (To be read with NADRA Ordinance 2000).
